Formula Expressions: Transform

Formula expressions are metrics that you define yourself as a function of other existing metrics. For example, let’s say you wanted to view your Gross Margin percentage in a report, but there was no pre-defined metric for it. BIQ allows you to create a metric or “transform” a metric using Formula Expressions.

Here is how you can define one in BIQ:

10. You can transform an existing metric by adding it to Report Definition, expanding the metric header, and then clicking TRANSFORM.

11. Alternatively, you can also click on the X2 icon in the Derived Metrics header in the column panel and then click ADD. This will allow you to automatically create a formula expression. 

 

 

12. In the transform window, specify the desired formula by selecting existing metrics from the Columns section. In the formula bar, you can type in parentheses and/or arithmetic operators (+-/*).

13. Note: You are also able to select Conditional Metrics that you have created and saved as part of your formula expression.

14. Click the CONTINUE button to verify your formula structure.

15. Once your formula is validated, name your column, specify whether you would like the resulting figures demonstrated as a percentage (%), real number, or currency ($), and specify the number of decimal places to display, if needed:

 

16. Click OK.  

 

If you have “transformed” an existing metric by expanding that metric header in the Report Definition and clicking TRANSFORM, then the column will now show up in your Report Definition. To edit the formula expression you just created, click on the column name in the Report Definition to expand the menu, and then click on TRANSFORM.

To be able to frequently re-use a formula expression you defined, you can save the formula by checking the Re-use box at the bottom of the transform panel when creating the formula expression:

When you click OK, your saved column will now appear in the Derived Metrics section of the Column Panel.

You can edit your saved column by clicking on the X2 icon in the Derived Metrics header and then clicking on the pencil icon. You can also delete your saved column simply by clicking on the ‘X’ icon.
